metadata.synopsis: Dialog with the real harper in Danthelon basement after saving him from a doppelganger ambush. He tells us how Jaheira's Harpers were infiltrated and killed, while he was forced to lure her into a trap. Jaheira will want to dismiss Geraldus for his own safety, but the player can intervene.

25.speaker: Jaheira
25.text: And some explaining to do, it seems.
25.context: NodeContext: Tired sigh, resigned to tell the player everything.

47.speaker: Harper Geraldus
47.text: Did I - did I get it right?
47.context: InternalNodeContext: Player and Jahiera are talking to harper

41.speaker: Jaheira
41.text: Selûne's Tears. It is said no false face can stand beneath their light.

15.speaker: Jaheira
15.text: An old code, Harper - but yes, you got it right. Now I need your report.

48.speaker: Harper Geraldus
48.text: We had eyes on suspected cultists in the city, like you asked. We thought we were tracking them, but...

30.speaker: Jaheira
30.text: They were tracking you instead, evidently. Doppelgangers.

12.speaker: Harper Geraldus
12.text: And they're not just working with the cult, High Harper - they're part of it. Bhaalists, I think.

61.speaker: Jaheira
61.text: Sworn to Orin the Red, yes. We've... already had the pleasure. Go on.

65.speaker: Harper Geraldus
65.text: Everything seemed fine, until... your latest orders. Until we started to search for the Rashemaar.

38.speaker: Harper Geraldus
38.text: They struck the same night. I woke to one of them strangling Chelvin, while smiling at me out of her face.

45.speaker: Harper Geraldus
45.text: She said - it said - that I'd report back to you as normal. Lure you here, and... I had no choice.

7.speaker: Jaheira
7.text: I'm sure it felt that way, Geraldus. The others were likely dragged back to Orin. Tortured. Sacrificed.

31.speaker: Jaheira
31.text: I do not expect you to die for me. But to risk Entharl? Any citizen who might have wandered in?

74.speaker: Jaheira
74.text: There is always a choice - and a Harper must be able to make the hard ones. Perhaps this isn't the life for you after all, Geraldus.

13.speaker: Harper Geraldus
13.text: No. Jaheira - High Harper - please. I'm still a Harper. I want to help.

72.speaker: Jaheira
72.text: You've scarcely signed up, boy, and there is a war coming. Why die a Harper, when you could still live as anything else?

60.speaker: Player
60.text: No one can make that choice for him. Not even you, High Harper.

82.speaker: Harper Geraldus
82.text: I want to fight... for Chelvin. For all of them. So it means something.

80.speaker: Jaheira
80.text: Death is death. To look for meaning in it is foolishness, boy. Childish, storybook nonsense.

64.speaker: Jaheira
64.text: ...Exactly the kind a Harper would spout, I suppose. Fine. I have no right to make the choice for you.

17.speaker: Jaheira
17.text: Not when this mess is of my making. I sent the Harpers hunting after the cult without thinking what it would mean to be hunted in turn. Now they are compromised.

49.speaker: Player
49.text: She's right, Geraldus. You did your part. Go live your life.

21.speaker: Jaheira
21.text: This work isn't for everyone, boy, and there's no shame in that. Go home to your mother, and leave the task to us.

18.speaker: Player
18.text: Wait, Jaheira. You're acting like this is his fault - it's yours.

36.speaker: Jaheira
36.text: I most humbly beg your pardon?
36.context: NodeContext: Translation: What the fuck did you just say?

23.speaker: Player
23.text: This talk of the Rashemaar. It sounds like you sent Harpers hunting something you shouldn't have.

55.speaker: Jaheira
55.text: You speak of something you know nothing about. But then - why would you, when I have not told it?

1.speaker: Player
1.text: Geraldus lived so he could warn you. Don't Harpers serve the greater good?

78.speaker: Jaheira
78.text: You volunteer wisdom where it is not wanted. All the more galling, then, that you are right.

9.speaker: Jaheira
9.text: I will not. If I bare my teeth, it is probably because you have struck at a sore spot.

50.speaker: Jaheira
50.text: This mess is of my making. I sent the Harpers hunting after the cult without thinking what it would mean to be hunted in turn. Now they are compromised.

34.speaker: Jaheira
34.text: And if not for you, I wouldn't even know it. I'm sorry, Geraldus. Harper.

57.speaker: Jaheira
57.text: And I owe you an apology, as well. I haven't told you everything I hoped to learn here today.

32.speaker: Jaheira
32.text: First, Geraldus - you're the last Harper in the city I can rely on. Lay low, and rest while you can. I have matters to discuss with my friend here.

71.speaker: Player
71.text: Enough of the Harper dramatics. What do we do now?

44.speaker: Jaheira
44.text: I'll come clean. I did not tell you all about what I hoped to learn here today - I will rectify that.

54.speaker: Jaheira
54.text: But first - Geraldus. Does your mother still own that farm in the Dalelands?

58.speaker: Jaheira
58.text: Just Jaheira to you, now. Go on - I have all the help I need.

81.speaker: Jaheira
81.text: Answering to Orin the Red, then. Go on.
81.context: NodeContext: Quick, grim pause for thought on the idea of Orin having a horde of shapeshifters in her service. Brusquely back to the point, keeping Geraldus on topic.

70.speaker: Harper Geraldus
70.context: InternalNodeContext: Only player (not Jaheira) is talking to harper

67.speaker: Player
67.text: No thanks necessary. Are you hurt?

66.speaker: Harper Geraldus
66.text: I'm... alive. That's more than the others can say.

3.speaker: Player
3.text: Don't thank me yet. How do I know you're not a doppelganger, too?

77.speaker: Player
77.text: What was all that 'Selûne's Tears' nonsense?

28.speaker: Harper Geraldus
28.text: A Harper code. Meant to be used for doppelgangers, impostors. Things like them.

73.speaker: Harper Geraldus
73.text: You're... you're the one High Harper Jaheira sent?

52.speaker: Player
52.text: I am. I'm here to help.

14.speaker: Harper Geraldus
14.text: Oh thank the gods. You're the first friendly face I've seen in days, old Danthelon included.

76.speaker: Player
76.text: She didn't send me anywhere. We're allies. Equals.

11.speaker: Harper Geraldus
11.text: Right... equal to the High Harper. You can give her my report, then.

46.speaker: Player
46.text: I'm not a Harper. I was just passing by.

6.speaker: Harper Geraldus
6.text: Old Danthelon wouldn't have let you down here without Jaheira's say-so. I'll give you my report - it's up to you after that.

35.speaker: Harper Geraldus
35.text: The others... they're all dead, or scattered. Jaheira sent word of the victory over Ketheric, set us hunting after cultists in the city.

29.speaker: Harper Geraldus
29.text: But they were the ones hunting us. Things were quiet - until we started to ask about the Rashemaar.

59.speaker: Narrator
59.text: *Rashemaar - a native of Rashemen, the far eastern land known for its wild inhabitants and the witches who rule them.*

33.speaker: Player
33.text: Who is this Rashemaar? What does Jaheira want with them?

51.speaker: Harper Geraldus
51.text: I... the High Harper didn't tell you? Perhaps... it's not my place.

24.speaker: Harper Geraldus
24.text: You saw it. The cult fell on my friends, and took their faces. All because Jaheira sent us searching for him.

53.speaker: Harper Geraldus
53.text: Just... tell her this. I can't continue the hunt. Whatever the cult has done with the Rashemaar - they do not want him found.
